result.execSummary:
The defendant James Casey Whitman was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Sex Registry Violation, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 301.45(6)(a)1.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Pay all costs, fees and surcharges. Provide DNA sample (unless previously submitted) and pay DNA surcharge. All costs, fees and surcharges are due by 9/21/15. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
Consecutive to: Court ordered defendant to serve 1 DAY in the House of Correction consecutive to any sentence; straight time; credit for 1 day time served.; TIME SERVED DISPOSITION.

Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess any gun or other firearms. 
Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. James Casey Whitman

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Jury Trial date of 7/20/15 was vacated at the time of the plea and sentencing hearing on 6/22/15. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.

Defendant James Casey Whitman in court with attorney Mary Garvin Guimont.  Michael Christopher Schindhelm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy court clerk ccp.
Case set for final pretrial. Parties have reached a resolution in this matter. Plea hearing proceeded.
Defendant sworn in.

As to COUNT 1-
Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Addendum, and Jury Instructions received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the defendant guilty.  Judgment of conviction entered.
  
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess any gun or other firearms. 
Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.  

Court advised defendant if he is not a citizen of the United States of America, that upon a plea of guilty or no contest for this offense, he could be deported, excluded from admission to his country, or denied naturalization under federal law.  
Court advised that the defendant will have to provide a DNA sample, to the Wisconsin State Crime Laboratory for DNA testing and pay a DNA surcharge.

Defendant James Casey Whitman in court with attorney Mary Garvin Guimont.  Christopher Allen Liegel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Deputy court clerk ccp.
Case set for plea hearing. Defense counsel requests an adjourned plea date as the defendant is not yet compliant with the sex offender registry. State does not object to an adjournment. Court ordered this matter be set for final pretrial and jury trial dates. If the parties reach a resolution, the court will hear a plea on the date of the final pretrial. Case adjourned to Branch 25.  Final pre-trial scheduled for June 22, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for July 20, 2015 at 09:00 am.

Defendant James Casey Whitman in court with attorney Mary Garvin Guimont.  Christopher Allen Liegel appeared via phone for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy court clerk ccp.
Case set for plea hearing. Branch 25 is in trial and unable to hear this matter. Defense counsel will be starting a jury trial in Branch 15 and requests an adjournment. State is in trial in Branch 10 and does not object. Court granted defense request.  Agreed Upon Request for a New Court Date is signed and filed. Case adjourned to Branch 25.  Plea hearing scheduled for May 27, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant James Casey Whitman in court with attorney Mary Garvin Guimont.  Christopher Allen Liegel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Deputy court clerk ccp.
Case set for scheudling conference. Defense counsel has received discovery and an offer from the State and requests a projected plea date. Case adjourned to Branch 25.  Plea hearing scheduled for May 6, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant James Casey Whitman in court with attorney Richard Carpenter for Mary Garvin Guimont.  Ron Dague for Christopher Allen Liegel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Rothstein, Branch 25.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference to Branch 25.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 23, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant James Casey Whitman in court with attorney Joan E. Zawikowski.  Defendant James Casey Whitman in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: dds.

Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Rothstein, Branch 25.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 7, 2015 at 08:30 am.

ADDRESS INFO for James Casey Whitman
Current: 3757 S. Lenox St., Milwaukee, WI 53207   (Effective: 03-29-2015)
Prior: Last Registered Address: 4229 W. Garfield Ave., Milwaukee, WI 53208
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
Arrest Warrant received from the D.A.'s office on filing date of Criminal Complaint.
